title: Data for "Double-Sided Electron Energy Analyzer for Measurement of Non-Maxwellian Electron Energy Distributions"
abstract: Data needed to reproduce figures in the publication

title: Data for figures in "Experimental study of Alfvén wave reflection from an Alfvén-speed gradient relevant to the solar coronal holes"
abstract: The data for the figures are given here in machine readable format.
keywords: Plasma physics; Laboratory Astrophysics; Alfvén wave; solar coronal holes; fast solar wind; Solar coronal heating

title: Applicability of Alkali Beam Emission Spectroscopy on NSTX-U
abstract: The files under this record contain the data that can be used to recreate the figures in the paper titled "Applicability of Alkali Beam Emission Spectroscopy on NSTX-U" published in Review of Scientific Instruments. This study proved that the alkali beam emission spectroscopy (ABES) technique can be applied to the NSTX-U spherical tokamak for electron density profile and fluctuation measurements. This was proven by analyzing the photon emission current, the resulting signal-to-noise ratio, the atomic physics smearing, the geometrical smearing, and the fluctuation-response matrix of the proposed ABES system.

title: O-Mode instability for non-thermal continuum radiation generated near the plasmapause
abstract: This includes data for a journal article "O-Mode Instability for Non-thermal Continuum Radiation Generated near the Plasmapause". It includes Matlab data and files shown in the forthcoming Journal article.
keywords: magnetospheric wave; ordinary mode instability; non-thermal continuum radiation

title: Data for "Exploration of the parameter space of quasisymmetric stellarator vacuum fields through adjoint optimisation"
abstract: This dataset contains the DESC input files with the boundary coefficients of the optimised stellarator configurations presented in the accompanying paper 'Exploration of the parameter space of quasisymmetric stellarator vacuum fields through adjoint optimisation’.

title: Data for "Improved stellarator permanent magnet designs through combined discrete and continuous optimizations"
abstract: This archive contains data related to the paper, "Improved stellarator permanent magnet designs through combined discrete and continuous optimizations", published in Computer Physics Communications (https://doi.org/10.1016/j.cpc.2024.109127). Included are data plotted in the figures, as well as input and output files for some optimizations and equilibrium models.

title: Alfvén waves at the interface of solar wind and magnetosphere
abstract: This includes data for Chapter 11 Alfvén waves at the interface of solar wind and magnetosphere in Book "AGU Monograph. Alfvén Waves across Heliophysics: Progress, Challenges, and Opportunities." It includes Matlab data and files for figures 2, 3, 4, 6, 7, 11 and 12 shown in the forthcoming book chapter.
keywords: Alfven wave; Alfven resonance; Ion ion hybrid resonance; Kelvin Helmholtz waves; Mode conversion; Magnetopause; Wave coupling

title: Data for "Real-time capable modeling of ICRF heating on NSTX and WEST via machine learning approaches"
abstract: Figure data for the paper 'Real-time capable modeling of ICRF heating on NSTX and WEST via machine learning approaches' published in Nuclear Fusion, DOI 10.1088/1741-4326/ad645d.
keywords: machine learning; surrogate modeling; data-driven; neural networks; ICRF; plasma heating; tokamak

title: Absolute electron density fluctuation reconstruction for two-dimensional Hydrogen beam emission spectroscopy
abstract: Scrape-off layer (SOL) and edge plasma turbulence contribute significantly to the radial particle and heat transport lowering plasma confinement and increasing heat load on the plasma facing components. SOL turbulence is predominantly intermittent which manifest in the occurrence of isolated density filaments or blobs. Filaments propagate radially outwards towards plasma facing components limiting their lifetime by erosion and sputtering. To characterize this phenomenon in detail few diagnostic techniques are available. Beam emission spectroscopy is a diagnostic capable of measuring plasma turbulence in both SOL and edge plasmas. Due to the finite lifetime of the excitation states during the beam - plasma interaction, and the misalignment between the optics and the magnetic field, spatial smearing is introduced in the measurement. In this paper a novel method is introduced to overcome this hindering effect by inverting the fluctuation response matrix on an optimally smoothed signal. We show that this method is fast and provides significantly more accurate absolute density fluctuation reconstruction than the direct inversion technique. The presented method is usable for all types of beam emission diagnostics where the spatial resolution is higher than the combined smearing of the atomic physics and the observation.
keywords: fluctuations response; numerical method; scrape-off layer turbulence

title: Data from the Princeton Field Reversal Configuration (PFRC) Experiment
abstract: The data includes Excel, HDF5, TXT, TRC and MCA files for the experiments conducted using PFRC between 2014 and 2023. Data includes raw, intermediate and post processed data from the interferometer, fast camera, visible spectroscopy and SDD X-ray diagnostics, RF power characteristics, pressure gauges, probes, gas puff characteristics, axial boundary potentials, and residual gas analyzer (RGA). There is a lot of data in these files that are PDF documents made by scanning screenshots of Lecroy Digital Storage Oscilloscopes displays used to accumulate and analyze the data, Runsheet based on the diagnostics that displays the experimental parameters and the file numbers.
keywords: field reversed configuration; spectroscopy; X-ray measurements

title: Intrinsic toroidal rotation driven by turbulent and neoclassical processes in tokamak plasmas from global gyrokinetic simulations
abstract: Digital data for the paper "Intrinsic toroidal rotation driven by turbulent and neoclassical processes in tokamak plasmas from global gyrokinetic simulations". More details can be found in README.txt.
keywords: plasma turbulence; momentum transport; gyrokinetic simulations

title: Data for "Valuing maintenance strategies for fusion plants as part of a future electricity grid"
abstract:
This contains the data and analysis scripts needed to reproduce the figures in the paper "Valuing maintenance strategies for fusion plants as part of a future electricity grid". 
It also contains extra data corresponding to all the runs performed, not all of which have data points displayed in the plots. These could be used for re-analyses.

Data were created using the GenX capacity expansion and optimization code.
    We used a branch of GenX 0.3.6, modified to model fusion reactors.
    GenX is available at https://github.com/GenXProject/GenX
    and the specific versions used are achived below via Zenodo:
    Two branches of GenX were used:
        https://github.com/cfe316/GenX/tree/feature-fusion (for MedOppMaintenance-rev4)
            commit b35767788466ecc0077899fbe863568e26fa9784
            https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.10607649
        https://github.com/cfe316/GenX/tree/feature-fusion-maintenance-pairs (for MedOppMaintenance-rev5)
            commit 0ffe45f0fdc562b62111e772bfd47eb7b20860ac
            https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.10607696

    GenX was run on Princeton's `della` cluster using Julia 1.6.7.
    Gurobi 9.5.2 was used as the optimizer for GenX.

Files for Steps 1 and 2 are found at http://arks.princeton.edu/ark:/88435/dsp012j62s808w.

title: Data for "NSTX-U research advancing the physics of spherical tokamaks"
abstract: Data for figures in the paper "NSTX-U research advancing the physics of spherical tokamaks" submitted to Nuclear Fusion in 2024.

authors.affiliation_name: The University of Texas at Austin

title: Dataset for the paper 'anomalous resistivity and electron heating by lower hybrid drift waves during magnetic reconnection with a guide field'
abstract: later

title: Data for "Chasing the multi-modal plasma response in MAST-U"
abstract: This deposit contains the data created for the manuscript. Figures 1 and 2 are fit of the experimental data from the MAST-U experiment. The rest of the data were created with the MARS-F code (Liu et al 2000 Phys. Plasmas 7 3681) and analyzed using ad hoc python scripts.

title: Data for "Predictive modeling of NSTX discharges with the updated MULTI-MODE anomalous transport module"
abstract: Data for figures in Nuclear Fusion journal article titled "Predictive modeling of NSTX discharges with the updated MULTI-MODE anomalous transport module". Data files consist of CSV files that are in each folder of the ZIP file corresponding to the figure (e.g., Folder "1" correspond to Figure 1")

title: Data for paper: DECAF Cross-device characterization of tokamak disruptions indicated by  abnormalities in plasma vertical position and current
abstract: The paper is conducting a cross-device and cross-shot analysis of disruption precursors using the DECAF code. In particular, occurrence of disruptions explored via detection of a plasma current quench and exploration of disruptive event chains, constituted by plasma current and vertical position abnormalities, was reported for in total 7 full device-years of operation pairs of 3 machines (NSTX-U, MAST-U and KSTAR). It was shown that the disruption occurrence captured through theIp quench depended not only on details of the plasma state, but also on (device-dependent) technical details of the shot exit scenario. A year-to-year change in main disruption triggers and even a reduction of the disruptivity rate, bound with device and operation upgrades, were reported. Particular trigger instances of disruptive event chains (and the full chains, when applicable) were shown to occupy predominantly distinct parts of the operation space diagrams, in accordance with a prior expectation. Plasma elongation was identified as an important factor influencing triggers.

title: Figure data for "Vertical Instability Forecasting and Controllability Assessment of Multi-device Tokamak Plasmas in DECAF with Data-driven Optimization"
abstract: Figure data for manuscript "Vertical Instability Forecasting and Controllability Assessment of Multi-device Tokamak Plasmas in DECAF with Data-driven Optimization". Data as raw x-, y-, and z- (where appropriate) values are stored in the csv files for ease of interpretation in various data analysis programs.

title: Data for "Divertor heat load estimates on NSTX and DIII-D using new and open-source 2-D inversion analysis code"
abstract: This dataset will contain the data for most figures in the associated publication. The data will be in .csv format and the descriptions are listed in the README.txt file.

title: Data of kinetic equilibrium reconstruction and transport and stability analysis of NSTX and NSTX-U plasmas
abstract:
Data for figures in the paper "Accuracy of kinetic equilibrium reconstruction of NSTX and NSTX-U plasmas and its impact on the transport and stability analysis", contains files with results of equilibrium reconstruction, plasma profiles analysis, transport and stability simulations for the NSTX plasma discharge 129017 and NSTX-U  discharge 204202. Data collection and the data analysis
were performed using the OMFIT integrated modeling framework.

title: Data for "In-Situ Relative Calibration of Bragg Crystals with Monte Carlo Line Ratio Analysis"
abstract: Numerical data used to produce the plots in the paper, "In-Situ Relative Calibration of Bragg Crystals with Monte Carlo Line Ratio Analysis." Plots reflect x-ray spectra that were gathered from two spectrometers that were cross-calibrated.

title: Full-wave simulations on helicon and parasitic excitation of slow waves near the edge plasma
abstract: Full-wave simulations of helicon and slow mode waves in DIII-D have been conducted using the Petra-M simulation code. The manuscript investigates the effect of misalignment of the Faraday screen and electron density in the scrape-off layer on the excitation and propagation of fast helicon and slow mode waves.
keywords: RF waves; Helicon waves; Slow waves; Tokamak

title: Supplemental material for "Applicability of Alkali Beam Emission Spectroscopy on NSTX-U"
abstract: Supplemental material for "Applicability of Alkali Beam Emission Spectroscopy on NSTX-U" to meet the 6 page limitation of the HTPD special issue.
